repnme.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Second Road Rehabilitation and
            Maintenance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The assessment of outcome is
            satisfactory, sustainability likely, and the institutional
            development impact substantial. Lessons reinforce that the
            successful implementation of the project is largely due to
            the effective partnership between the client counterparts,
            and the Bank, and to the commitment, and dynamic direction
            of the implementing agency, contributing factors to the
            excellent disbursement, and timely completion of civil
            works. This contributed to the development of an efficient
            construction industry; however, the performance of
            contractors in the smallest category, continues to be poor.
            It is thus recommended that future projects consider larger
            works for small works contracts, based on performance. An
            area for attention in the roads sector, is that of
            sustainable maintenance funding, through the establishment
            of a Roads Fund, linked to user charges, to ultimately set
            up an independent National Roads Board. Given the recurring
            annual flooding in Bangladesh, it is recommended that the
            Government be prepared for such emergencies by ensuring
            access to critical commodities, and services for immediate
            rehabilitation works, and a system for periodic maintenance
            of the road infrastructure would minimize flood damages.
            Regarding road safety, it is imperative that the Government
            conduct road safety audits, and implement an action plan
            involving stakeholders, public-private partnerships,
            communities, and nongovernmental organizations to commence
            implementing remedial measures.

repnme.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Second Road Rehabilitation and
            Maintenance Project

abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Road Rehabilitation and
            Maintenance Project will assist the Roads and Highway
            Department (RHD) to initiate physical implementation of the
            Road Master Plan for the main road network in Bangladesh,
            thus preserving the capital base of the road system and
            improving high priority sections in a systematic manner. The
            4-year time slice financed under the project includes about
            168 km of rehabilitation, 100 km of widening to 2-lane
            standard and 1,800 km of periodic maintenance in areas west
            of the Jamuna. The project will also enhance the
            country's institutional and technical capacity to
            operate and maintain the main road network through: a)
            technical assistance for programming and supervising the
            project road works and for carrying out feasibility studies
            and other preparation activities for future road
            construction and improvement works; and b) an institutional
            development program, comprising consultancy services,
            twinning arrangements, officer and staff training, research
            and associated equipment, for RHD and other road agencies.
            While integrating and building upon past technical
            assistance, the primary focus will be improved planning,
            management and implementation of road works in the subsector.

repnme.cdata!:
Bangladesh - Second Road Rehabilitation and
            Maintenance Project : environmental analysis

abstracts.cdata!:
This document presents an environmental
            analysis of the Second Road Rehabilitation and Maintenance
            Project (RRMP-II), a Bank funded project for road
            improvements in the western portion of Bangladesh. The
            purpose of this environmental analysis is to: improve
            decision-making and to ensure that the project options under
            consideration are environmentally sound and sustainable; to
            recognize environmental consequences early in the project
            cycle and take these consequences into account in project
            selection, siting, planning design and execution; and to
            identify ways to improve projects environmentally, by
            preventing, minimizing, mitigating or compensating for
            adverse impacts and avoiding the need for costly remedial
            measures after the fact. Environmental investigations can
            also provide formal mechanisms for interagency coordination
            on environmental issues; for addressing concerns of affected
            groups and local nongovernmental organizations (NGOs); and
            for building environmental management capabilities within
            borrower countries.

display_title.display_title:
Bangladesh - Second Road
            Rehabilitation and Maintenance Project : environmental
            analysis : Report : environmental analysis

            measures after the fact. Environmental investigations can
            also provide formal mechanisms for interagency coordination
            on environmental issues; for addressing concerns of affected
            groups and local nongovernmental organizations (NGOs); and
            for building environmental management capabilities within
            borrower countries.
